choices.C: Configure the Linux machine to add a UID field to messages
choices.B: Convert the date to the time zone of the system
choices.D: Filter out the text of the message to speed up searches
choices.A: Reverse lookup the IP address to add a hostname field

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Agree with A.

questions.question_text: Which approach must be used to integrate DevOps practices into the team structure in an existing organization?

choices.A: Create a team that can deliver all the stages with active cooperation between the team members
choices.B: Create a team that can deliver all the stages with well-defined roles and a communication structure between team members
choices.C: Create a team for each stage with structured communication channels
choices.D: Create a team for each stage with active cooperation between the teams

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which action allows the development team to reach the deployed application?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I agree with the solution, "B".

choices.C: Delete the deployment and redeploy by using a ReplicaSet.
choices.A: Create an init container to initialize routes for the containers in the pod
choices.D: Delete the deployment and redeploy by using the latest tag for the container image
choices.B: Create a service to expose the logic running in the pod

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
I prefer B & E
B. Changes must include automated tests
- B is the obvious answer
E. Team members must be responsible for the code committed by any team member
- E seems to be related to code reviews

Not likely answers:
A. Changes must be scheduled to deploy at a specific time that has minimal traffic
- A is a traditional methodology, but goes against the idea of CI/CD
C. Changes must be validated during deployment to the production environment
- C - this seems wrong because changes should be validated *before* deployment to prod
D. Smaller, individually testable changes must be merged first
- D not sure how smaller changes first improves the process, with continuous integration the changes should be integrated when they are available.

questions.question_text:
An organization is developing an application using Git. Each team member is assigned to work on specific parts of the application. At the end of each task, individual code parts are merged in the main build.

Which two requirements should be implemented to increase the likelihood of continuous integration? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Smaller, individually testable changes must be merged first
choices.C: Changes must be validated during deployment to the production environment
choices.E: Team members must be responsible for the code committed by any team member
choices.A: Changes must be scheduled to deploy at a specific time that has minimal traffic

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I don't like any of the choices, but I suppose the best one is 
D. integrates with container orchestration

choices.A: eliminates the need to run integration tests within the CI/CD pipeline
choices.C: eliminates the need for CI/CD tools
choices.B: provides high native monitoring of services

questions.question_text: What is an advantage of using configuration management tools to automate infrastructure services?
